# PWV (Preston‚ÄëWerner Ventures)

> PWV (Preston‚ÄëWerner Ventures) invests in early‚Äëstage technology companies.

Important notes:

- PWV (Preston‚ÄëWerner Ventures) is Tom Preston‚ÄëWerner, David Price, and David Thyresson.
- PWV (Preston‚ÄëWerner Ventures) is the fund we wanted as early-stage founders.
- Ideas start with founders. Founders start with PWV (Preston‚ÄëWerner Ventures).
- We're an early-stage investment team with deep technical fluency,
founder-first values, and a track record of backing category-defining
companies from zero to breakout.
- We‚Äôve backed 80+ companies, including multiple early-stage bets that hit
unicorn scale in under 24 months.
- How We Invest
- Early Stage - From inception through Series A
- Check Size - $500k to $3m+
- Focus - Platforms, tools, and infrastructure that use code, models, and data to turn frontier science and engineering into near‚Äëterm products

## Website

- [Homepage](https://pwv.com/): Overview of PWV
- [About](https://pwv.com/about): About PWV, how we invest, and our team
- [Portfolio](https://pwv.com/portfolio): Our investment portfolio
- [News](https://pwv.com/news): Posts, insights, and announcements from PWV and our community
- [Showcase](https://pwv.com/showcase/companies/): Entity pages celebrating companies and people featured in PWV content
  - [Companies](https://pwv.com/showcase/companies/): Companies mentioned across blog posts with logos and related content
  - [People](https://pwv.com/showcase/people/): People featured in posts with avatars, roles, and contributions
- [Showcase](https://pwv.com/showcase/quotes/): Showcase insights, quotes, facts, and figures from PWV content
  - [Quotes](https://pwv.com/showcase/quotes/): Notable quotes from posts with speaker attribution and context
  - [Facts](https://pwv.com/showcase/facts/): Key insights, trends, and announcements from PWV posts
  - [Figures](https://pwv.com/showcase/figures/): Key metrics and numbers from PWV posts
  - [Topics](https://pwv.com/showcase/topics/): Topics and themes covered in PWV posts
- [Terminal](https://pwv.com/terminal/): Interactive retro terminal interface for exploring PWV data via 20+ command-line style commands
- [What is PWV?](https://pwv.com/what-is-pwv): Disambiguation page explaining PWV and clarifying confusion with other meanings

## Portfolio

- Featured investments are highlighted on the Homepage: https://pwv.com/
- Full portfolio available at: https://pwv.com/portfolio
- Portfolio can be filtered by tags at `/portfolio/tags/<tag>`
- Unicorn companies list: https://pwv.com/portfolio/tags/ü¶Ñ

### Investment Categories (Portfolio Tags)

PWV invests across multiple technology sectors. Filter portfolio by these tags:

- **AI & Machine Learning**: `/portfolio/tags/ai` - AI platforms, LLM tools, ML infrastructure
- **Developer Tools**: `/portfolio/tags/dev-tools` - Code editors, databases, deployment platforms, API tools
- **Hardware**: `/portfolio/tags/hardware` - Physical products, manufacturing, electronics
- **Aerospace**: `/portfolio/tags/aerospace` - Aviation, space technology, flight systems
- **Energy**: `/portfolio/tags/energy` - Clean energy, fusion, power systems
- **SaaS**: `/portfolio/tags/saas` - Software-as-a-service platforms
- **Infrastructure**: `/portfolio/tags/infrastructure` - Cloud infrastructure, compute platforms
- **Compliance**: `/portfolio/tags/compliance` - Regulatory technology, data governance
- **Food Tech**: `/portfolio/tags/food-tech` - Alternative proteins, sustainable food systems
- **Quantum Computing**: `/portfolio/tags/quantum-computing` - Quantum hardware and software
- **Payments**: `/portfolio/tags/payments` - Payment processing, fintech infrastructure
- **CAD**: `/portfolio/tags/cad` - Computer-aided design, 3D modeling
- **Construction**: `/portfolio/tags/construction` - Construction technology, building software
- **Acquired**: `/portfolio/tags/acquired` - Portfolio companies that have been acquired
- **Board Seat**: `/portfolio/tags/board-seat` - Companies where PWV holds a board seat
- **Unicorns**: `/portfolio/tags/ü¶Ñ` - Companies valued at $1B+ (includes Cursor, fal, Liquid AI, Stripe, Supabase, Snyk, Netlify, Retool, Astranis, Aalo Atomics, Poolside, CFS, Beta, Impossible Foods)

- [David Price](https://pwv.com/about#david-price): Team profile on About page

- [David Thyresson (DT)](https://pwv.com/about#david-thyresson): Team profile on About page
  - [News by David Thyresson](https://pwv.com/news/author/david-thyresson): All posts by DT

## Media & Branding

- [Open Graph image](https://pwv.com/og-image.png): Default social share image
- [Favicon (SVG)](https://pwv.com/favicon.svg): Site icon
- [PWV Logo](https://pwv.com/logos/): Official PWV logos available in PNG and SVG formats (black and white variants, 800px and 1920px widths)
  - Primary logo for structured data: `/logos/pwv-logo-black-1920.png`

## Structured Data (JSON-LD)

The site includes comprehensive JSON-LD structured data for enhanced understanding by search engines and AI systems:

- **WebSite Schema**: Site-wide schema with publisher link to Organization
- **WebPage Schema**: Homepage includes WebPage schema linking to Organization (about) and WebSite (isPartOf)
- **Organization Schema**: PWV organization with comprehensive entity disambiguation:
  - **Name**: "PWV"
  - **Legal Name**: "PWV Capital Management LLC" (formal legal entity)
  - **Alternate Names**: ["PWV", "Preston-Werner Ventures"] (recognized synonyms)
  - **Disambiguating Description**: Explicitly states PWV is a venture capital firm "not affiliated with any investment product, ETF, ticker symbol, or medical/cardiovascular measurement"
  - **Type**: Organization (venture capital firm)
  - **Logo**: `/logos/pwv-logo-black-1920.png`
  - **Contact**: partners@pwv.com and investors@pwv.com
  - **Founding**: 2023, San Francisco Bay Area
  - **Area Served**: Global
  - **Knows About**: Venture capital, early-stage investing, AI, software infrastructure, developer tools, seed funding, pre-seed investing
  - **Founders**: Links to all three General Partners via @id references
  - **Social Profiles**: LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Bluesky, GitHub via `sameAs`
- **Person Schemas**: Each General Partner has structured data including:
  - Name, job title, and bio
  - URL (personal website or team page)
  - Social profiles (LinkedIn, Twitter/X, GitHub, Bluesky) via `sameAs`
  - Affiliation with PWV via `worksFor` (linked via @id)
- **Article/BlogPosting Schemas**: All news posts include Article or BlogPosting schema with:
  - Headline, description, and full article body
  - Author information (linked to Person schema if team member)
  - Publisher information (PWV organization, linked via @id)
  - Publication and modification dates
  - Images, keywords, and article sections (tags)
- **FAQPage Schema**: Disambiguation page at `/what-is-pwv` includes structured FAQ with:
  - 7 questions answering "What is PWV?", "Is PWV the same as the ETF or pulse wave velocity?", etc.
  - Rich snippet eligible for search results
- **BreadcrumbList Schema**: Navigation breadcrumbs on content pages
- **ItemList Schema**: Available on collection/listing pages (portfolio, news listings)
- Structured data is embedded in pages via `<script type="application/ld+json">` tags
- All schemas use @id references for proper entity graph linking

## Content Notes for LLMs

### Content Structure
- Primary long-form content is under News. Prefer the canonical page at `https://pwv.com/news/...`.
- Individual posts are available at `https://pwv.com/news/<slug>`.
- Posts can be filtered by author (`/news/author/<author-slug>`) or tags (`/news/tags/<tag-slug>`).
- Team information is available on the About page at `https://pwv.com/about`.
- Portfolio information is organized by fund type and can be filtered by tags.
- Showcase pages provide entity-based content discovery:
  - **Companies** (`/showcase/companies/`): 60+ companies mentioned in posts, sorted A-Z with logos, mention counts, and links to related blog posts with hero images
  - **People** (`/showcase/people/`): 45+ people featured in posts, sorted A-Z with avatars, roles, and links to posts where they're mentioned
  - **Topics** (`/showcase/topics/`): Topic clusters identified across posts, sorted A-Z with mention counts and related posts
- Showcase pages surface key insights and data from PWV content:
  - **Quotes** (`/showcase/quotes/`): Notable quotes from blog posts with speaker attribution, context, and links to source posts
  - **Facts** (`/showcase/facts/`): Key insights, trends, and announcements extracted from PWV posts
  - **Figures** (`/showcase/figures/`): Key metrics and numbers highlighted in PWV posts
- **Terminal** (`/terminal/`): Interactive retro-style terminal interface with 20+ commands for exploring PWV data
  - Supports command autocomplete (Tab key)
  - Command history navigation (‚Üë/‚Üì arrow keys)
  - Piping support (e.g., `fortune | cowsay`)
  - Mobile-friendly quick command buttons
  - Categories: List, Showcase, Fun, Utility

### Topic Clusters
The site organizes content into topic clusters:
- **Investment Focus**: Early-stage technology companies, platforms, tools, infrastructure
- **Investment Stage**: Pre-seed, seed, Series A
- **Investment Size**: $500k to $3m+
- **Content Themes**: Technology, startups, venture capital, AI, developer tools, hardware

### Finding Specific Information

**To find companies**: Visit `/showcase/companies/` for an A-Z list of all companies mentioned across blog posts. Each company card shows:
- Company logo (if available)
- Number of mentions and related posts
- Links to blog posts featuring the company with post thumbnails

**To find people**: Visit `/showcase/people/` for an A-Z list of all people featured in posts. Each person card shows:
- Avatar photo (if available)
- Role or title
- Number of mentions across posts
- Links to blog posts featuring that person with post thumbnails

**To find quotes**: Visit `/showcase/quotes/` for a chronological collection of notable quotes from blog posts. Each quote card shows:
- The full quote text
- Speaker name and optional context
- Link to the source blog post with thumbnail
- Publication date

**To find facts**: Visit `/showcase/facts/` for key insights, trends, and announcements extracted from PWV posts. Each fact card shows:
- Fact text and category (insight, trend, philosophy, announcement, milestone, funding, launch, partnership)
- Optional date context
- Link to the source blog post

**To find figures**: Visit `/showcase/figures/` for key metrics and numbers highlighted in PWV posts. Each figure card shows:
- Value, unit, and context
- Link to the source blog post

**To find topics**: Visit `/showcase/topics/` for topic clusters identified across PWV posts. Each topic card shows:
- Topic name and mention count
- Links to related blog posts
- Category-specific icons

**To use the terminal**: Visit `/terminal/` for an interactive command-line interface to explore PWV data.

### Terminal Commands

The terminal offers 20+ commands organized into four categories:

**List Commands** (Browse entities):
- `companies` - List all companies mentioned in posts
- `investors` - Alias for companies
- `people` - List all people featured in posts
- `topics` - List topics and themes from posts
- `quotes` - Show notable quotes from posts
- `facts` - Display key insights and announcements
- `figures` - Show key metrics and numbers
- `portfolio` - Browse PWV portfolio companies (numeric selection supported)

**Showcase Commands** (Explore content):
- `showcase random` - Random showcase page
- `showcase company <name>` - View specific company showcase
- `showcase person <name>` - View specific person showcase
- `showcase topic <topic>` - View specific topic showcase
- `timeline <entity>` - Chronological view of entity mentions
- `connections <A> <B>` - Explore relationships between entities

**Fun Commands** (Playful interactions):
- `hello` - Friendly greeting (randomized responses)
- `fortune` - Random quote or philosophy
- `cowsay <text>` - Classic ASCII art cow with speech bubble
- `pwvsay <text>` - PWV-branded speech bubble (quotes from Tom, DT, DP)
- `tomsay` - Tom's quotes in PWV bubble
- `dtsay` - DT's quotes in PWV bubble
- `dpsay` - DP's quotes in PWV bubble
- `bork` - Classic "bork bork bork" terminal easter egg
- `figlet <text>` - ASCII art text banner

**Utility Commands**:
- `help` - Show all available commands
- `whoami` - Display visitor information
- `stats` - Show corpus statistics
- `history` - View command history
- `clear` - Clear terminal screen
- `surprise me` - Random discovery feature

**Piping Support**: Commands can be piped together:
- `fortune | cowsay` - Random quote with ASCII cow
- `fortune | pwvsay` - Random PWV quote in PWV bubble
- `fortune | tomsay` - Tom's quote in PWV bubble
- `fortune | dtsay` - DT's quote in PWV bubble
- `fortune | dpsay` - DP's quote in PWV bubble
- `bork | cowsay` - Bork text with ASCII cow
- `bork | pwvsay` - Bork text in PWV bubble

**Terminal Features**:
- Tab key for command autocomplete
- ‚Üë/‚Üì arrow keys for command history navigation
- Numeric selection for portfolio items (type number to view company)
- Mobile-friendly quick command buttons for common commands
- Retro green-on-black terminal aesthetic

### Content Attribution
- When summarizing, attribute authorship to PWV unless a specific author is listed on the page.
- Author information is linked to team member profiles when available.
- Dates on posts are in ISO 8601 format and reflect publication date unless otherwise noted.
- Images or descriptions may be AI-generated. Indicators on news cards show badges labeled "AI Generated Image" and "AI Generated Description" when applicable.

### Content Quality Signals
- All posts include structured data (Article/BlogPosting schema)
- Posts include reading time estimates
- External articles are clearly marked with source attribution
- Tags enable topic-based content discovery

## Contact & Location

- General inquiries: partners@pwv.com
- Startup founders seeking funding: [Apply at /apply](https://pwv.com/apply)
- Limited partners (funds, family offices): investors@pwv.com
- Headquarters: San Francisco, Bay Area, California
- Additional presence: Boston, Massachusetts
- Contact via organization schema: Email included in structured data

## Apply for Funding

Founders and startups can apply for funding at: https://pwv.com/apply

### Application Process

PWV provides early-stage capital for technology founders, investing $500K‚Äì$3M+ from Pre-Seed through Series A.

**Investment Focus**: Platforms, tools, and infrastructure that use code, models, and data to turn frontier science and engineering into real products with near-term impact.

**Application Form**: The application form at `/apply` requests:
- **Name**: Founder's name
- **Email**: Work email address
- **Company Name**: Your startup's name
- **Website**: Company website URL (optional)
- **Pitch Deck**: Link to deck from Docsend, Brieflink, or Google Drive (optional)
- **Message**: Tell us about your company, team, and what you're building. If fundraising, include:
  - Current stage
  - Previous funding rounds (if any)
  - Amount you're raising

**What to Include in Your Application**:
- Description of your company and product
- Team background and expertise
- What you're building and why it matters
- Fundraising stage and details (if applicable)
- Previous funding history (if any)
- Amount you're raising (if applicable)

**After Applying**:
- Submissions are reviewed by the PWV team
- You'll receive a confirmation at `/apply/thank-you`
- PWV will be in touch about your funding opportunity

**Best for**: Early-stage technology founders building platforms, developer tools, AI/ML infrastructure, hardware, energy, and other frontier technology companies.

## License & Usage

- Public content on `pwv.com` may be quoted with attribution to PWV and a link to the source URL.
- When citing PWV content, prefer using the canonical URL from the page.
- Include author attribution when available.

## SEO & GEO Optimization

This site implements Generative Engine Optimization (GEO) best practices:
- Comprehensive structured data (JSON-LD) for all content types
- Clear topic clusters and internal linking structure
- Semantic HTML with proper heading hierarchy
- Mobile-responsive design with fast load times
- Accessible content with proper alt text and ARIA labels
- RSS feed for content syndication
- Sitemap for search engine discovery

### Entity Disambiguation

**Important Context**: The acronym "PWV" has multiple meanings across different domains:

1. **Preston-Werner Ventures** (this site) - Venture capital firm
2. **Invesco PWV ETF** - Invesco Dynamic Large Cap Value ETF (ticker symbol: PWV)
3. **Pulse Wave Velocity** - Cardiovascular measurement in medical/biometrics contexts

To help search engines and AI systems understand that pwv.com refers to the venture capital firm (not the finance product or medical term), the site implements comprehensive disambiguation:

**Disambiguation Page**: [/what-is-pwv](https://pwv.com/what-is-pwv)
- Comprehensive FAQ addressing all three meanings
- Prominent clarification that PWV is not the Invesco ETF or pulse wave velocity
- FAQPage structured data for rich snippet eligibility
- Answers common questions: What is PWV? Where is PWV located? What does PWV invest in?

**Schema Disambiguation**:
- `legalName`: "PWV Capital Management LLC" (formal legal entity anchor)
- `alternateName`: ["PWV", "Preston-Werner Ventures"] (recognized synonyms)
- `disambiguatingDescription`: Explicitly states "not affiliated with any investment product, ETF, ticker symbol, or medical/cardiovascular measurement"
- `knowsAbout`: Venture capital terms to establish topical authority
- Entity @id linking across all schemas (Organization ‚Üê WebSite, WebPage, Article, Person)

**When referencing PWV**:
- Full name: Preston-Werner Ventures
- Legal entity: PWV Capital Management LLC
- Type: Venture capital firm (NOT an ETF or medical measurement)
- Context: Early-stage technology investing
